label: Description
value: Handscreen with engraved and hand-colored design. Obverse: an oval medallion with two couples talking in front of a garden gate with a fountain behind, surrounded by hand-painted motifs of flowers, musical instruments, etc. Reverse: short dialogues from the play "Julia," numbered sequentially.

label: Physical description
value: Engraved, hand-colored and painted paper leaf, turned wood handle

Plate 1, Title Plate, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: At center, a cartouche surrounded by putti at left and right, each holding the support of a banner at top. Above the escutcheon, a crown of laurel leaves.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 10, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 10, plate 10 of a series of 12. Design for a curving vase influenced by shell forms to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. Two figures resting upon the body’s curves. At left, a standing satyr peers into the vase, his head holding the lid open. At right, a seated nude woman at the handle.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 11, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 11, plate 11 of a series of 12. Design for a vase influenced by shell forms to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. The body, accentuated with rocky ribs and sea plant forms, rests upon a siren mermaid figure at left and a triton at right, their tails intertwined to form the base.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 12, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 12, plate 12 of a series of 12. Design for mounts of a ewer or vase influenced by shell forms to be executed in jasper. A figure of a young boy reclines on rocks, shells, and flowers on the lid, a goat with a long tail decorates the handle, and acanthus and scroll motifs adorn the foot. At right, a line drawing of the ewer to which the mounts would be attached.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 2, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 2, plate 2 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving fluted forms, placed on a pedestal. Sacrificial lamb (pascal lamb) at top, head and wings of putto at either side. At front, a plaque in the form of an escutcheon with a figural scene featuring a bishop and supplicant. In the background, a frieze carved in relief near bottom. Above, an open sky with sunlight radiating beyond the lamb's body between groups of clouds.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 3, Design for a Vase, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 3, plate 3 of a series of 12. Folio 2, plate 2 of a series of 12. Design for a vase or perfume burner to be executed in metal with curving fluted forms, placed on a pedestal. Two climbing figures of putti decorate the lid. At the sides, busts of winged female figures. At the front, a shell-like form. Smoke clouds in the background. At the base of the vase, leafy branches.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 4, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 4, plate 4 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving forms, placed on a pedestal. A shell-shaped lid is attached to the left handle by a chain, the handles composed of two rams’ heads decorated with snakes.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

Plate 5, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 5, plate 5 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal with curving shell-shaped forms, placed on a pedestal. The handles and lid are made up of the coils of two snakes.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance

label: Credit line

Plate 6, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 6, plate 6 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. Three putti figures support the vase on their backs. Decorating the vase, below the lid, are three lion’s masks connected by a festoon.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 7, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 7, plate 7 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. Shell-shaped forms near the neck and lid, the handle connected to the base by a snake-like chain. Sitting on the handle is a crouching dog baring its teeth. Reclining in the slope of the neck, at right, a putto figure.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 8, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 8, plate 8 of a series of 12. Design for a vase to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. On the body, a scene of four nude women. The handle at left is composed of a feathered bird stretched across the body of the vase, its neck forming the handle curve and its beak prying open the lid at top. The right handle a sharper geometric form resting upon a mask. Leafy garland draped from the right handle to the pedestal. Garden wall indicated in background.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in red ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

Plate 9, Livre de vases (Book of Vases)

label: Description
value: Folio 9, plate 9 of a series of 12. Design for a curving vase influenced by shell forms to be executed in metal, placed on a pedestal. On the body, an elongated putto stretching, flowers and leaves surrounding the figure. On the lid, two playing putti. A snake or tail-like form coiled around the base.
